poem:
**Capitol Discord**

Amidst the pillars of democracy's old haunt,  
A dance of compromise trudges on, weary.  
Voices clash in the echoing chambers;  
A nation teeters, its heart dismayed.  
Men in their suits, shadows of ambition,  
Play their cards on green felt tables—  
While beneath, currents of unseen hands  
Stir the quiet rage of the unheard.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump administration briefing: Democrats divided as funding bill passes; president rails against justice department The US Senate averted a government shutdown just hours before a Friday night deadline after 10 Senate Democrats joined nearly all Republicans to clear a key hurdle that advanced the six-month stopgap bill. The vote deeply dismayed Democratic activists and House Democrats who had urged their Senate counterparts to block the bill, which they fear would embolden Donald Trump and Elon". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
